popt4jlib.PS.FA

Class DFA

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.PS.FA.DFA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObserverIntf, OptimizerIntf, SubjectIntf

    public final class DFA
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptimizerIntf, SubjectIntf, ObserverIntf
    A parallel implementation of the Firefly Algorithm for function optimization, implementing also the SubjectIntf and ObserverIntf objects. The class implements the Subject/ObserverIntf interfaces so that it may be combined with other optimization processes and produce better results. By implementing the SubjectIntf of the well-known Observer Design Pattern, the class allows any observer objects implementing the ObserverIntf to be notified whenever a new incumbent is found and then to enrich the class's population (in island thread with id=0) by adding back into the first island' population new (hopefully better) solutions. The solutions moved back and forth between optimizers have to be moved as function argument objects and not as chromosome objects. However, the Subject/Observer interactions destroy the otherwise deterministic order & results of the DFA execution due to the fact that the order in which DFAThreads call the setIncumbent() method which in turn may call the notifyObservers() method is not deterministically fixed (depends on thread schedules).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      void addIncumbent(ObserverIntf obs, java.lang.Object soln)
      allows an ObserverIntf object to add back into the DFA process an improvement to the incumbent solution it was given.
      private void addSubjectIncumbent(SubjectIntf subject, java.lang.Object soln)
      add the soln into a hashmap maintaining (SubjectIntf, Object soln) pairs so that the soln is inserted in the first DFAThread's population in the next iteration.

      PairObjDouble minimize(FunctionIntf f)
      the most important method of the class.
      void notifyChange(SubjectIntf subject)
      when a subject's thread calls the method notifyChange, in response, this object will add the best solution found by the subject, in the _subjects' solutions map to be later picked up by the first DFAThread spawned by this DFA object.
      void notifyObservers()
      notifies every ObserverIntf object that was registered via a call to registerObserver(obs) -and has not been removed since- by calling the ObserverIntf object's method notifyChange(SubjectIntf this).
      boolean registerObserver(ObserverIntf observer)
      allows an Object that implements the ObserverIntf interface to register with this DPSO object and thus be notified whenever new incumbent solutions are produced by the DFA process.
      boolean removeObserver(ObserverIntf observer)
      removes an Object that implements the ObserverIntf that has been registered to listen for new solutions.
      private void reset()
      reset the barrier and other objects used in the process

      (package private) void setIslandPop(int id, int size)

      the optimization params are set to p.
      (package private) void transferSolutionsTo(java.util.Vector tinds, java.util.Hashtable params, java.util.Hashtable funcParams)
      moves all chromosomes that the observers and subjects have added so far to _individuals Vector of the DFAThread with id 0, and clears the solutions from the _observers and _subjects map.

      • setParams

        public void setParams(java.util.Hashtable p)
               throws OptimizerException
        the optimization params are set to p. The method will throw if it is invoked while another thread is running the minimize(f) method on the same DPSO object.
        Parameters:
        p - Hashtable the parameters to pass-in
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if another thread is concurrently running the minimize(f) method of this object.

      • registerObserver

        public boolean registerObserver(ObserverIntf observer)
        allows an Object that implements the ObserverIntf interface to register with this DPSO object and thus be notified whenever new incumbent solutions are produced by the DFA process. The ObserverIntf objects may then independently produce their own new solutions and add them back into the DFA process via a call to addIncumbent(observer, functionarg). The order of events cannot be uniquely defined and the experiment may not always produce the same results.
        Specified by:
        registerObserver in interface SubjectIntf
        Parameters:
        observer - ObserverIntf.
        Returns:
        boolean returns always true.

      • removeObserver

        public boolean removeObserver(ObserverIntf observer)
        removes an Object that implements the ObserverIntf that has been registered to listen for new solutions. Returns true if the observer was registered, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        removeObserver in interface SubjectIntf
        Parameters:
        observer - ObserverIntf
        Returns:
        boolean

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        notifies every ObserverIntf object that was registered via a call to registerObserver(obs) -and has not been removed since- by calling the ObserverIntf object's method notifyChange(SubjectIntf this).
        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface SubjectIntf

      • getIncumbent

        public java.lang.Object getIncumbent()
        returns the currently best known function argument that minimizes the _f function. The ObserverIntf objects would need this method to get the current incumbent (and use it as they please). Note: even though the method is not synchronized, it still executes atomically, and is in synch with its counterpart, setIncumbent().
        Specified by:
        getIncumbent in interface SubjectIntf
        Returns:
        Object

      • addIncumbent

        public void addIncumbent(ObserverIntf obs,
                java.lang.Object soln)
        allows an ObserverIntf object to add back into the DFA process an improvement to the incumbent solution it was given. The method should only be called by the ObserverIntf object that has been registered to improve the current incumbent.
        Specified by:
        addIncumbent in interface SubjectIntf
        Parameters:
        obs - ObserverIntf
        soln - Object

      • minimize

        public PairObjDouble minimize(FunctionIntf f)
                       throws OptimizerException
        the most important method of the class. Some parameters must have been previously passed in the _params map (via the ctor arg or via a call to setParams(p) to do that). These parameters are:
      • <"dfa.randomfireflymaker",RandomChromosomeMakerIntf maker> mandatory, the RandomChromosomeMakerIntf Object responsible for creating valid random chromosome Objects to populate the firefly-islands.
      • <"dfa.cupdater",ChromosomeUpdaterIntf updater> mandatory, an Object that implements the ChromosomeUpdaterIntf that produces the next position of a particle given its current position and that of its better neighbors.
      • <"dfa.numthreads",Integer nt> optional, how many threads will be used, default is 1. Each thread corresponds to an island in the DGA model.
      • <"dfa.c2amaker",Chromosome2ArgMakerIntf c2a> optional, the object that is responsible for tranforming a chromosome Object to a function argument Object. If not present, the default identity transformation is assumed.
      • <"dfa.a2cmaker",Arg2ChromosomeMakerIntf a2c> optional, the object that is responsible for transforming a FunctionIntf argument Object to a chromosome Object. If not present, the default identity transformation is assumed. The a2c object is only useful when other ObserverIntf objects register for this SubjectIntf object and also add back solutions to it (as FunctionIntf args)
      • <"dfa.numgens",Integer ng> optional, the number of generations to run the DFA, default is 1.
      • <"dfa.immprob",Double prob> optional, the probability with which an sub- population will send some of its members to migrate to another (island) sub-population, default is 0.01
      • <"dfa.numinitpop",Integer ip> optional, the initial population number for each island, default is 10.
      • <"ensemblename", String name> optional, the name of the synchronized optimization ensemble in which this DFA object will participate. In case this value is non-null, then a higher-level ensemble optimizer must have appropriately called the method Barrier.setNumThreads(name+"_master", numParticipantOptimizers) so as to properly synchronize the various participating optimizers' threads. Also, if this object is to be re-used as a stand-alone optimizer, this key-value pair must be removed from its parameter-set via a call to setParams(p) prior to calling minimize(f) again. If the optimizer ensemble is to call its minimize(f) method again, then it must make sure to have reset the Barrier.getInstance(name+"_master") object via a Barrier.removeInstance(name+"_master"); Barrier.setNumThreads(name+"_master", numOptimizers); ComplexBarrier.removeInstance(name); series of calls.
Specified by:
minimize in interface OptimizerIntf
Parameters:
FunctionIntf - f
Returns:
PairObjDouble // Pair
